figurative_meaning: To ignore something or turn a blind eye.
example: You can't just sit with your eyes closed while the problem gets worse.

literal_meaning: Don't spit into the well you drink from.
figurative_meaning: Don't harm those who help you.
example: It's important to treat your friends well; don't spit into the well you drink from.

literal_meaning: He who hides his illness will die.
figurative_meaning: Ignoring problems can lead to worse outcomes.
example: You need to address your issues; remember, he who hides his illness will die.

literal_meaning: Don't touch the freshly baked bread.
figurative_meaning: Don't interfere with something that is just starting to develop.
example: Let them figure it out on their own; don't touch the freshly baked bread.

literal_meaning: If you hit with a stone, don't hit the stone.
figurative_meaning: Don't attack something that can fight back.
example: Be careful with your words; if you hit with a stone, don't hit the stone.
If you wait for the right moment, remember: patience is golden.

literal_meaning: A crow does not poke another crow's eye.
figurative_meaning: People in the same situation often protect each other.
example: He won't tell on his friend; a crow does not poke another crow's eye.

figurative_meaning: Both parties are responsible in a conflict.
example: In any disagreement, remember that one hand cannot clap; both sides have roles.
Don't worry about that issue; it's just a chicken's egg in the grand scheme of things.
